typeCode.description: valid types include DirectShip,  Normal,  TransferOrder (e.g., the PO side of the transfer order)

identifier.description: This is the PurchaseOrder identifier generated by the sender's business application.
This is an alternate identifier for the PurchaseOrder, requires the use of the typeCode qualifier.  This could be a system level key.

lastModificationDateTime.description:
ISO 8601 formatted update timestamp for the document, if the action code is changed or deleted. 
Example - '2018-01-02T10:08:11.000-06:00'

note.description: This is a note that may be placed on the purchase order by the sender, such as special packing, messages, or other instructions that cannot normally be mapped into other fields.  This should not be overloaded when existing fields can be mapped.

description.description: Description of the status code sent.

reasonCode.description: codified reason for the reason the status code has been applied or the if the effective time period has changed.

reason.description: additional textual reason for the reason the status code has been applied or the if the effective time period has changed.

startDateTime.description: Effective start time for which the order should be fulfilled

endDateTime.description: Effective end time for which the order should be fulfilled

contact.description: This is the customer representative placing the order, including name, phone and email contact information

formattedName.description:
Formatted string; <familyName>, <givenName> <middleName>
If you can populate these fields directly, use givenName, familyName, middleName instead.

directions.description: Directions for the location, especially in the case of direct ship

uri.description: URI link to a mapping service showing the exact location on a map

contact.description: This is the key contact at the ShipTo location, in case there are delivery questions.

formattedName.description:
Formatted string; <familyName>, <givenName> <middleName>
If you can populate these fields directly, use givenName, familyName, middleName instead.

physicalAddress.description: This is the physical address for the shipment

deliveryPointIdentifier.description: delivery point may be a loading dock, etc.

countrySubDivisionCode.description: Two character state code in the United States, Province in Canada, etc.  See ISO 3166-2.

countryCode.description: ISO ALPHA-2 two character country code see countrycode.org

totalAmount.description: This is the total amount of the purchase order, which is the sum of each purchase order lines, plus calculated tax.

accountIdentifier.description: Specific Account for the customer BillTo

identifier.description: Identifier for the location, if no GLN is used.

postalAddress.description: This is the mailing address for which invoices should be sent, if not electronically sent.

countrySubDivisionCode.description: Two character state code in the United States, Province in Canada, etc.  See ISO 3166-2.

postalCode.description: ISO ALPHA-2 two character country code see countrycode.org

note.description:
Note on the BillTo lcoation
Example:

scacid.description: This is only used if the customer is arranging transportation to pickup the order, or if there is a carrier preference

accountIdentifier.description: customer's account number with the carrier if the customer is specifying a carrier

tax.description: These are various taxes that may be applied.  There may be multiple tax values for VAT, etc.

code.description: state or province from which the tax applies.

basisAmount.description: sum of the individual items without tax

amount.description: Total estimated amount of tax for the order

currencyExchangeRate.description: current exchange rate at the time of the transaciton

orderDateTime.description:
ISO 8601 formatted original date of the Purchase Order as created in the sender's business application.. 
Example - '2018-01-01T09:08:01.000-06:00'

identifier.description:
This is often not known at the time the order is place, but will appear on the AcknowledgePurchaseOrder Callback API or 
GET //AcknowledgePurchaseOrder request response service
This is the buyer's identifier for the item

code.description:
Code used to classify the item being purchased.
If code is mapped, the typeCode should also be mapped since this a generic code.

exportControl.description: If the ShipTo defines an import of the product into the country, the identifiers for customs clearance are required.

amountDiscount.description: If provided, customer service will evaluate for applicability.
